meanings.definition: To move back and forth or up and down with short, quick movements.
meanings.sent1: The dog was shaking its tail happily.
meanings.sent2: She was shaking the rug to remove the dust.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches were shaking as if they were dancing.
meanings.sent4: The boat was shaking in the rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake was shaking the entire city.

meanings.sent1: He was shaking with fear during the scary movie.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge was shaking in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The kitten was shaking with excitement for its new toy.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was shaking as she spoke in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The ground was shaking beneath their feet during the earthquake.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise was shaking the windows.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news was shaking her confidence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was shaking the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His words were shaking the foundation of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The scandal was shaking the entire community.
